{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox Organization |name = Inter-American Division of Seventh-day Adventists |image = |image_border = |size = <!-- default 200 --> |alt = <!-- alt text; see [[WP:ALT]] --> |caption = | main_classification = [[Protestant]] | orientation = [[Adventist]] | polity = [[Government of the Seventh-day Adventist Church|Modified presbyterian polity]] |map = <!-- optional --> |msize = <!-- map size, optional, default 200px --> |malt = <!-- map alt text --> |mcaption = <!-- optional --> |abbreviation = |motto = |formation = |extinction = <!-- date of extinction, optional --> |type = Religious/Non-Profit |status = <!-- ad hoc, treaty, foundation, etc --> |purpose = |headquarters = |location = 8100 S.W. 117th Avenue Miami, Florida 33183-4827 |coords = <!-- Coordinates of location using a coordinates template --> |region_served =[[Anguilla]], [[Antigua and Barbuda]], [[Aruba]], [[Bahamas]], [[Barbados]], [[Belize]], [[Bonaire]], [[British Virgin Islands]], [[Cayman Islands]], [[Colombia]], [[Costa Rica]], [[Cuba]], [[CuraÃ§ao]], [[Dominica]], [[Dominican Republic]], [[El Salvador]], [[French Guiana]], [[Grenada]], [[Guadeloupe]], [[Guatemala]], [[Guyana]], [[Haiti]], [[Honduras]], [[Jamaica]], [[Martinique]], [[Mexico]], [[Montserrat]], [[Nicaragua]], [[Panama]], [[Puerto Rico]], [[Saba]], [[Sint Eustatius]], [[Saint Kitts and Nevis]], [[Saint Lucia]], [[Saint Martin]], [[Saint Vincent and the Grenadines]], [[Suriname]], [[Trinidad and Tobago]], [[Turks and Caicos Islands]], [[United States Virgin Islands]], and [[Venezuela]]. |membership = |language = <!-- official languages --> |leader_title = |leader_name = |main_organ = <!-- gral. assembly, board of directors, etc --> |parent_organization = [[General Conference of Seventh-day Adventists]] |affiliations = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = [http://www.interamerica.org/users/ www.interamerica.org/users/] |remarks = }}
The '''Inter-American Division of Seventh-day Adventists''' is a sub-entity of the [[General Conference of Seventh-day Adventists]]. Its headquarters are in [[Miami, Florida|Miami]], [[Florida]], [[United States]]. It covers the area of the nations of [[Anguilla]], [[Antigua and Barbuda]], [[Aruba]], [[Bahamas]], [[Barbados]], [[Belize]], [[Bonaire]], [[British Virgin Islands]], [[Cayman Islands]], [[Colombia]], [[Costa Rica]], [[Cuba]], [[CuraÃ§ao]], [[Dominica]], [[Dominican Republic]], [[El Salvador]], [[French Guiana]], [[Grenada]], [[Guadeloupe]], [[Guatemala]], [[Guyana]], [[Haiti]], [[Honduras]], [[Jamaica]], [[Martinique]], [[Mexico]], [[Montserrat]], [[Nicaragua]], [[Panama]], [[Puerto Rico]], [[Saba]], [[Sint Eustatius]], [[Saint Kitts and Nevis]], [[Saint Lucia]], [[Saint Martin]], [[Saint Vincent and the Grenadines]], [[Suriname]], [[Trinidad and Tobago]], [[Turks and Caicos Islands]], [[United States Virgin Islands]], and [[Venezuela]]. It is the only division of the church whose headquarters are outside the territory that it administers.
The InterAmerican Division is one of the fastest-growing divisions of the church. It is sub-divided into eight conferences and seven missions:
